I hope it continues to be like this because he is such an easy traveler! - [![Leka](https://photos.bringfido.com/user/6o8e67VuWa/LekaRomao.jpg?size=avatar&density=2x)\\ \\ Leka\\ \\ \\ More than a year ago](https://www.bringfido.com/user/1705493) ![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg) Best Experience in cabin with my pup We were worried about flying across the country (San Diego to Pittsburgh) with my 17lbs (20.6lbs with the Sherpa carrier) poddle mix. The experience was so flawless that I couldn’t not write this review. Will drop a few tips below as well. When we first arrived at the SD airport checkin, my dog was sitting down with the Sherpa top zipper open. The lady was questioning that she was looking a bit too big for the carrier, and politely asked me to see her fully inside. I dropped a treat in her bag, and zipped up the top completely. She smiled and asked me to weigh my pup, 20lbs no problem. On the way back (PIT airport) I already walked into checkin with her fully inside/zipped, and the lady didn’t even ask for anything nor asked to weigh her OR sign anything. So pro tip: bring your pet already inside the carrier when you walk into checkin to avoid questions. Same goes for boarding the plane (we had stops in Chicago on the way in and in DFW on the way back). For all 4 flights we boarded the plane with my bb already in the carrier/zipped, and some flight attendants even asked “puppy!! what kind is it??” and overall got super excited to have a pup in the flight. During takeoff, I kept her under the seat in front of me, but she was never fully zipped in, and appreciated being able to keep and eye on us, and getting some pets. Once we were up in the air, for most of the flight we took her out of the carrier and she slept alll the way (she doesn’t need meds and is very calm when traveling) in between our seats. I’m sure flight attendants saw it, and never asked or bothered us at all, since she was extremely calm and just napping between our seats. This was her second time on a plane. First was Southwest to New Orleans last May, and it was also a great experience, except that multiple times we got asked to put her fully zipped up inside the bag. With this not having happened a single time with us in any of the 4 airports or planes, I need to say this was a flawless experience, and it made American my first choice when bringing my pup. I wish they would do South America flights with pups in cabin again, will definitely choose them again. Quick info: pup is a 2.5yo, 17lbs poodle mix. Didn’t use any sedatives or medicine at all, just a lot of treats, toys and blankets to keep her cozy. ![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/empty.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/empty.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/empty.svg) Breeze Airways has received a rating of 2.0 out of 5 bones by 4 canine critics on BringFido. ![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/loading.svg) Unable to load. - [![Jonathan](https://photos.bringfido.com/user/IfFDAF0UdI/JonathanFox.jpg?size=avatar&density=2x)\\ \\ Jonathan\\ \\ \\ Aug. 29, 2024](https://www.bringfido.com/user/2000073) ![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg) Flying with our dog was a Breeze We have a 1.5 year old 15lb "tweenie" dachshund, and we've mostly flown Delta since we started traveling with him. This past week, we had our first experience on Breeze and it was great! As with anything, read their policy carefully (https://www.flybreeze.com/support). Some of the bad experiences could have been avoided by doing that. The booking process is simple - you add and pay for your pet when you're making the reservation. This is not like Delta where you need to call/message after booking to add the pet, and then pay at the check-in counter. Since our pup was on the reservation and paid, we didn't have to do anything special when checking in. There wasn't even a tag that went on his carrier (Delta gives you a green "Cabin Pet") tag. At no point along the way were we stopped and asked about our dog. Truly a seamless process. We have the Away Pet Carrier which meets the posted dimensions for a cabin pet carrier. Nobody double checked measurements or weights. However, don't try to sneak a larger carrier on board. It will not fit under the seat. These are standard airline seats, a bigger carrier won't fit on this or any other airline. We booked the "nicer" seats with a little extra legroom close to the front of the plane (5A and 5C to be exact) which was nice because we could reach down and give him pets and snacks. I'd recommend doing the same. The Ascent seats in the front do not allow pets. So the "nicer" seats are the best you'll be able to do. The policy is that the carrier must be closed at all times. In our experience, nobody batted an eye at the front flap being open during flight so he could stretch out more (he's clipped into the carrier so he can't escape). This has been true on every flight we've taken, regardless of the airline. That said, the policy is the policy and they have every right to enforce it. The crew all said "bye" to him when we disembarked. Delta has never even acknowledged him. Overall, I'd highly recommend flying Breeze with your pet. The $75 each way is cheaper than most other domestic airlines too. - [![David](https://photos.bringfido.com/user/U0oUcPR4Go/DavidDean.jpg?size=avatar&density=2x)\\ \\ David\\ \\ \\ Jun. 23, 2024](https://www.bringfido.com/user/1903646) ![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/empty.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/empty.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/empty.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/empty.svg) Seriously? We were going to travel with our 18lb pup but the dimensions for 17" x 8" x 13" is pathetic, and they expect a pet to fit in that and stand and turn around? Mind you they state up to 25 pounds. We have moved internationally 12 times over the past 18 years--always with pets. I also work in rescue and regularly rehome pets in other countries. Point is, I've taken/sent pets on assorted airlines more times than I can count. And I can say without a doubt that Austrian and Lufthansa are BY FAR the best for pets. Not only do they have excellent customer service, they actually CARE about your animals. When we missed our connecting flight from Vienna to Bosnia (after flying from Washington DC), they IMMEDIATELY made sure that our dogs were fed, watered, and taken out for relief. They kept us apprised of the dogs' status, and moved mountains to get us on the next available flight. They even called the people who were meeting us in Bosnia to make sure they would be there to pick us up with the dogs. They really bent over backwards for us, to the point where I think the other passengers were wishing they'd brought pets too! Really, they are just extraordinary. And their rates for pet transport are very reasonable--especially when compared to the ridiculous prices (and shoddy service) of US airlines. One tip: if you're calling to book pets on your flight and have Skype, call their customer service center in Vienna. The service is much better than at the US number, and you'll get an answer faster. - ![Default avatar](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/avatars/default.svg) Ashlyn More than a year ago ![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg)![](https://www.bringfido.com/assets/images/icons/brand/bones/full.svg) Great Pet Travel! I was very nervous to move overseas with my two dogs. I brought my ESA dog (55 pounds) and small dog in a carry on bag on our flight from Dulles to Vienna. I was absolutely blown away by the amazing service of the crew. They were kind, polite, and engaging; they constantly checked in with us and answered all of our questions. We were moved (at no charge) to the bulk head row for more room for our pets. The flight was comfortable and the food was fine; we arrived to Vienna early as well. I can not recommend Austrian more to anyone traveling overseas, especially with pets. Just contact the airline via phone and email (Special Services) for pet accommodations. Load More Reviews
